physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Symmetric muscular hypertrophy of the legs, discoloration of the left foot, and decreased skin temperature below the left knee. Absence of left popliteal, tibialis, and dorsalis pedis pulses. Ankleâ€“brachial blood-pressure index of 0.3.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At follow-up two months later, the leg musculature had diminished and the patient was asymptomatic at rest and while walking.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initially reported pH of 7.2, bicarbonate level of 8.8 mmol per liter, partial pressure of carbon dioxide of 26 mm Hg, anion gap of 15.4 mmol per liter, lactate level of 6.9 mmol per liter, and creatinine level of 1.8 mg per deciliter. After four days, worsened pH of 6.9 and bicarbonate level of 6.2 mmol per liter.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After three hemodialysis sessions, the patient's pH and bicarbonate level had improved to 7.37 and 26 mmol per liter, respectively.
